security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown documentation for implementing authentication and payment features. Includes security checklists and best practices. No network calls, no file system access beyond own files, no code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Users need secure ways to handle login and payments in their applications. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for implementing Clerk, Supabase Auth, and Stripe integrations with built-in security checklists.
actual_capabilities: Implement user authentication with Clerk or Supabase Auth
Create subscription and one-time payment flows with Stripe
Set up Webhook endpoints for payment notifications
Generate authentication middleware and protected routes
Configure customer portal for plan management
limitations: Does not provide backend server code
Does not handle database schema design
Does not include payment business logic
Requires external service accounts (Clerk, Supabase, Stripe)

best_practices: Always use HTTPOnly cookies for session management
Store passwords with bcrypt or argon2 hashing
Verify Stripe webhook signatures on the server
Confirm payment amounts server-side to prevent tampering
anti_patterns: Saving credit card numbers on your own servers
Showing detailed error messages that reveal system details
Logging sensitive data like passwords or payment tokens

faq.question: Which auth provider should I choose?
faq.answer: Clerk is easier for quick setup with UI components. Supabase Auth works well if you already use Supabase database.

faq.question: Does this skill handle payment refunds?
faq.answer: No. The skill focuses on checkout and subscription setup. Refund handling requires additional Stripe API integration.

faq.question: Can I use this with React Native?
faq.answer: Yes. Clerk and Supabase Auth both provide React Native SDKs. The authentication flow concepts apply similarly.

faq.question: Is my user data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill provides security guidance. Actual data safety depends on your implementation and the external services you use.

faq.question: Why am I getting auth errors after implementation?
faq.answer: Check your API keys are set correctly in environment variables. Verify middleware is protecting the correct routes.

faq.question: How is this different from implementing directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides step-by-step guidance, security checklists, and avoids common mistakes in auth and payment implementation.
